name: Aardvark
description: Nocturnal African mammal with a long snout, digs for ants and termites using its tongue.

name: Aardwolf
description: Small, shy relative of hyenas. Aardwolf feeds on termites and is active at night.

name: Addax
description: Rare antelope with twisted horns. Adapted for harsh Sahara, now critically endangered.

name: African Wild Dog
description: Wild dog with big ears and patchy fur. Hunts in packs across African grasslands.

name: Albatross
description: Large seabird with long wings. Albatrosses can glide for days over oceans.

name: Alligator
description: Large reptile with a strong jaw, found in swamps and rivers. Excellent ambush predator.

name: Alpaca
description: Gentle, fluffy animal raised for its soft wool. Alpacas live in herds in South America.

name: American Bison
description: Massive, shaggy animal once roaming North American plains in huge herds.

name: Anaconda
description: Huge South American snake that squeezes prey. Anacondas are among the world’s heaviest snakes.

name: Angelfish
description: Small, bright fish found in coral reefs. Angelfish are popular in home aquariums.

name: Anglerfish
description: Strange-looking fish with a glowing lure. Lives in deep ocean darkness, hunts with its light.

name: Anole
description: Small lizard able to change colors for camouflage. Lives in trees and shrubs.

name: Ant
description: Tiny, social insect living in colonies. Ants build tunnels and work together efficiently.

name: Antelope
description: Graceful, horned herbivore of grasslands and savannas. Known for speed and agility.

name: Arctic Fox
description: White-furred fox adapted for cold. Changes color with seasons for camouflage in the snow.

name: Arctic Hare
description: Thick-furred hare that survives freezing tundra. Changes fur color with seasons.

name: Armadillo
description: Small mammal with a hard shell. Good digger, lives in warm regions of the Americas.

name: Axolotl
description: Mexican salamander famous for its ability to regenerate limbs. Lives its whole life in water.

name: Aye Aye
description: Nocturnal lemur with large eyes and a long finger to find insects inside trees.

name: Baboon
description: Large monkey with a dog-like snout. Lives in troops and is highly social and expressive.

name: Badger
description: Stocky animal with striped face. Badgers are strong diggers and mostly nocturnal.

name: Bald Eagle
description: Iconic American bird with a white head. Bald eagles are powerful hunters and national symbols.

name: Barracuda
description: Fast, fierce fish with sharp teeth. Barracuda are top predators in tropical and subtropical seas.

name: Bass
description: Common freshwater fish. Bass are popular with anglers and found in lakes and rivers worldwide.

name: Bat
description: Only mammal capable of true flight. Bats use echolocation and eat insects or fruit.

name: Bear
description: Big, strong mammal with thick fur. Bears live in forests and mountains worldwide.

name: Beaver
description: Large, water-loving rodent known for building dams and lodges with wood and mud.

name: Bee
description: Vital insect for pollination, lives in hives and produces honey. Essential for nature.

name: Beetle
description: Most diverse group of insects, beetles have tough shells and many shapes and sizes.

name: Beluga
description: Small, white whale with a rounded forehead. Known for its vocal "canary" sounds.

name: Betta Fish
description: Vibrant, territorial fish popular in aquariums. Betta males are famous for their fins.

name: Binturong
description: Large, shaggy mammal called "bearcat." Binturongs smell like popcorn and live in trees.

name: Bison
description: Heavily built grazing mammal with humped shoulders. Bison are icons of the American plains.

name: Black Mamba
description: Africa’s fastest, deadliest snake. Black mambas are long and have potent venom.

name: Blue Jay
description: Bright blue songbird of North America, known for loud calls and social behavior.

name: Blue Whale
description: The largest animal on Earth. Blue whales eat tiny krill and can grow over 30 meters.

name: Boa
description: Large, non-venomous snake. Boas squeeze prey to eat and live in tropical forests.

name: Boar
description: Wild pig with tusks, coarse fur, and a strong sense of smell. Found in forests worldwide.

name: Bobcat
description: Solitary wild cat of North America. Bobcats have short tails and spotted coats.

name: Bonobo
description: Rare great ape, closely related to chimps. Bonobos are peaceful and found in Congo.

name: Booby
description: Ocean bird with bright feet, dives for fish. Boobies nest on islands in large colonies.

name: Budgerigar
description: Small, colorful parrot. Budgerigars are playful, sociable, and popular as pets.

name: Buffalo
description: Large, horned grazer of Africa and Asia. Buffalo are strong and often live near water.

name: Bushbaby
description: Tiny, big-eyed primate from Africa. Bushbabies leap between trees at night.

name: Butterfly
description: Delicate insect with colorful wings. Butterflies start as caterpillars before flying.

name: Caiman
description: Small, tropical relative of alligators. Caimans are found in Central and South America.

name: Calf
description: Young cow or bull, known for playful behavior. Calves grow quickly into adults.

name: Camel
description: Long-legged animal with a humped back. Camels are well adapted for life in the desert.

name: Canary
description: Small, bright-yellow songbird. Canaries are prized for their melodious singing.

name: Capuchin
description: Small, clever monkey from Central/South America. Capuchins use tools and live in trees.

name: Capybara
description: The world’s largest rodent. Capybaras love water and live in social groups.

name: Caracal
description: Wild cat with long tufted ears. Caracals are fast, powerful hunters in Africa and Asia.

name: Caribou
description: Large, wild reindeer found in cold climates. Caribou migrate long distances each year.

name: Carp
description: Common freshwater fish, often kept in ponds. Carp can adapt to many environments.

name: Cassowary
description: Huge, flightless bird from Australia and New Guinea. Cassowaries have bright necks.

name: Cat
description: Small, playful, and independent mammal. Cats are beloved as house pets worldwide.

name: Caterpillar
description: The larval stage of butterflies and moths, known for eating leaves and transforming.

name: Catfish
description: Fish with whisker-like barbels, found in rivers and lakes. Catfish are bottom dwellers.

name: Cavy
description: Small rodent, also known as guinea pig. Cavies are social and kept as pets.

name: Centipede
description: Long, segmented arthropod with many legs. Centipedes are fast predators in soil/leaves.

name: Chameleon
description: Lizard with eyes that move independently and skin that changes color for camouflage.

name: Cheetah
description: The fastest land animal, cheetahs sprint after prey on African grasslands.

name: Chickadee
description: Small, cheerful bird with a black cap. Chickadees are known for their “chick-a-dee” call.

name: Chicken
description: Common domestic bird raised for eggs and meat. Chickens are found worldwide.

name: Chimpanzee
description: Intelligent, social primate using tools. Chimpanzees live in African forests.

name: Chinchilla
description: Soft, fluffy rodent from South America. Chinchillas are prized for their dense fur.

name: Chipmunk
description: Small rodent with cheek pouches and striped back. Chipmunks are active and agile.

name: Cicada
description: Insect famous for loud summer sounds. Cicadas emerge in cycles and live underground as nymphs.

name: Civet
description: Cat-like mammal with a long tail and spots. Civets are active at night and eat fruit.

name: Clam
description: Soft-bodied animal in a two-part shell. Clams burrow in sand and filter water for food.

name: Clownfish
description: Bright orange and white fish, known for living in sea anemones. Clownfish are social.

name: Coati
description: Tropical mammal with a long nose and tail. Coatis are playful and curious foragers.

name: Cobra
description: Highly venomous snake with a hood. Cobras are famous for their warning display.

name: Cockroach
description: Hardy insect found everywhere. Cockroaches adapt quickly and eat almost anything.

name: Colobus
description: Black-and-white monkey from Africa. Colobus monkeys eat leaves and leap between trees.

name: Coral
description: Marine animal that forms reefs. Corals provide shelter for countless ocean species.

name: Cormorant
description: Water bird with a long neck. Cormorants dive deep to catch fish underwater.

name: Cow
description: Domesticated for milk, meat, and labor. Cows are gentle, social herd animals.

name: Coyote
description: Wild dog of North America. Coyotes adapt to many habitats and are skilled hunters.

name: Crab
description: Small, hard-shelled animal found in oceans and rivers. Crabs walk sideways and scavenge.

name: Crane
description: Long-legged bird found near water. Cranes perform elaborate mating dances.

name: Cricket
description: Small, jumping insect famous for its chirping at night. Crickets are common everywhere.

name: Crocodile
description: Large, predatory reptile. Crocodiles have powerful jaws and live in rivers and swamps.

name: Crow
description: Intelligent, adaptable bird, known for problem-solving. Crows live worldwide.

name: Deer
description: Hoofed grazer with antlers, found in forests and fields worldwide. Deer are shy and alert.

name: Dhole
description: Wild dog from Asia. Dhole lives and hunts in packs in dense forests.

name: Dik Dik
description: One of the smallest antelopes. Dik-diks live in African grasslands and are very alert.

name: Dingo
description: Wild dog native to Australia. Dingoes live in deserts, forests, and grasslands.

name: Dodo
description: Extinct, flightless bird from Mauritius. Dodo became a symbol of extinction.

name: Dog
description: Loyal, social mammal kept as a pet. Dogs are known for intelligence and companionship.

name: Dolphin
description: Social, intelligent marine mammal. Dolphins communicate with clicks and leaps.

name: Donkey
description: Hardy working animal. Donkeys are sure-footed and valued for carrying heavy loads.

name: Dove
description: Gentle bird symbolizing peace. Doves coo softly and are found in cities and forests.

name: Dragonfly
description: Fast, colorful insect with two pairs of wings. Dragonflies eat mosquitoes and other insects.

name: Duck
description: Waterfowl with webbed feet and a broad bill. Ducks are found on ponds, lakes, and rivers.

name: Duckling
description: Young duck covered in soft down. Ducklings swim after their mother and learn quickly.

name: Dugong
description: Large, gentle sea mammal called a "sea cow." Dugongs graze on seagrass in shallow waters.

name: Eagle
description: Large, powerful bird of prey with keen eyesight. Eagles soar high and hunt skillfully.

name: Echidna
description: Egg-laying mammal with spines like a hedgehog. Echidnas eat ants and live in Australia.

name: Eel
description: Long, slender fish with smooth skin. Eels live in both fresh and salt water.

name: Egret
description: Tall, graceful bird found in wetlands. Egrets have white plumage and hunt for fish.

name: Electric Eel
description: Fish that generates electric shocks. Electric eels use electricity to hunt and navigate.

name: Elephant
description: The largest land animal. Elephants have trunks and tusks and live in Africa and Asia.

name: Emu
description: Large, fast-running, flightless bird native to Australia. Emus have long legs and necks.

name: Falcon
description: Swift, predatory bird with sharp talons and a hooked beak. Falcons hunt by diving at high speed.

name: Fennec Fox
description: Small fox with huge ears, adapted for desert life. Fennec foxes stay cool in the Sahara.

name: Ferret
description: Slender, playful mammal with a long body. Ferrets are energetic and curious pets.

name: Finch
description: Tiny, lively songbird found worldwide. Finches have colorful plumage and varied songs.

name: Firefly
description: Beetle that lights up at night to attract mates. Fireflies are a summer night delight.

name: Flamingo
description: Tall wading bird with pink feathers. Flamingos get their color from their diet.

name: Fly
description: Common, fast-breeding insect. Flies are found everywhere and feed on many things.

name: Foal
description: Young horse, full of energy and curiosity. Foals can stand and run shortly after birth.

name: Fossa
description: Cat-like predator from Madagascar. Fossas are agile hunters in forests.

name: Fox
description: Small, smart mammal with a bushy tail. Foxes adapt to many environments.

name: Frigatebird
description: Large seabird known for stealing food from others. Frigatebirds glide effortlessly over oceans.

name: Frog
description: Moist-skinned animal that jumps. Frogs lay eggs in water and have a loud croak.

name: Galago
description: Also called bushbaby. Galagos are tiny, nocturnal primates from Africa.

name: Gaur
description: Wild cattle native to South Asia. Gaur are huge, strong animals living in forests.

name: Gazelle
description: Swift antelope with slender build and curved horns. Gazelles live in African grasslands.

name: Gecko
description: Small lizard with sticky toe pads for climbing. Geckos are active at night.

name: Genet
description: Small, spotted predator from Africa. Genets have long tails and live in trees.

name: Gibbon
description: Small, acrobatic ape known for swinging through trees. Gibbons are loud and social.

name: Gila Monster
description: Large, venomous lizard from the US Southwest. Gila monsters store fat in their tails.

name: Giraffe
description: The tallest land animal. Giraffes have long necks to reach high leaves in African trees.

name: Glass Frog
description: Small frog with see-through skin, revealing organs. Glass frogs live in Central/South America.

name: Glowworm
description: Insect larva that glows in the dark. Glowworms are found in caves and forests.

name: Gnu
description: Large African antelope, also called wildebeest. Gnus migrate in massive herds.

name: Goat
description: Domesticated for milk, meat, and wool. Goats are hardy, agile animals in many climates.

name: Golden Lion Tamarin
description: Bright orange monkey from Brazil. Golden lion tamarins live in treetops and are rare.

name: Goldfish
description: Bright orange fish often kept in ponds and aquariums. Goldfish are peaceful and hardy.

name: Goose
description: Large, honking bird found near water. Geese fly in flocks and are known for migration.

name: Gopher
description: Small, burrowing rodent that creates tunnels in fields and gardens. Gophers are diggers.

name: Gorilla
description: The largest living primate. Gorillas live in forests and form close family groups.

name: Grasshopper
description: Small, green insect with strong legs for jumping. Grasshoppers are found in fields.

name: Griffon Vulture
description: Large scavenging bird with broad wings. Griffon vultures soar over mountains in Europe/Asia.

name: Grizzly Bear
description: Large, powerful brown bear found in North America. Grizzly bears are top predators.

name: Grouse
description: Medium-sized ground bird. Grouse are found in forests and are hunted for sport.

name: Guinea Fowl
description: Spotted, ground-dwelling bird from Africa. Guinea fowl are raised for meat and eggs.

name: Guppy
description: Small, colorful fish popular in aquariums. Guppies breed rapidly and have lively colors.

name: Hagfish
description: Eel-like, jawless fish producing slime. Hagfish live in deep seas and scavenge on dead animals.

name: Hamster
description: Small, round rodent often kept as a pet. Hamsters store food in their cheeks.

name: Hare
description: Fast-moving mammal with long ears. Hares live in grasslands and open forests.

name: Hawk
description: Bird of prey with sharp vision and powerful talons. Hawks hunt rodents and small birds.

name: Hedgehog
description: Small mammal covered in sharp spines. Hedgehogs roll into a ball for protection.

name: Hen
description: Female chicken that lays eggs. Hens are common in farms and backyards.

name: Heron
description: Tall, slender bird found near water. Herons hunt fish with their sharp beaks.

name: Herring
description: Small, silvery fish that travel in schools. Herrings are important food for many animals.

name: Hippopotamus
description: Huge, mostly aquatic mammal with large jaws. Hippos spend most of their day in water.

name: Hog
description: Domestic pig with a stocky build and a flat snout. Hogs are raised for meat.

name: Horse
description: Large, strong animal used for riding, racing, and work. Horses have lived with humans for centuries.

name: Hummingbird
description: Tiny, hovering bird with fast wings. Hummingbirds drink nectar from flowers.

name: Hyena
description: Large African predator known for its laugh-like calls. Hyenas live in clans and scavenge.

name: Ibex
description: Wild goat with long, curved horns. Ibex are expert climbers found in rocky mountains.

name: Iguana
description: Large, calm lizard with a spiny back. Iguanas live in tropical forests and bask in the sun.

name: Impala
description: Sleek African antelope, famous for speed and leaping. Impalas gather in large herds.

name: Jackal
description: Small, clever wild dog of Africa and Asia. Jackals are scavengers and hunters.

name: Jaguar
description: Powerful big cat with rosettes on its coat. Jaguars are skilled swimmers and hunters.

name: Jellyfish
description: Soft, transparent sea creature. Jellyfish drift and sting with tentacles.

name: Kangaroo
description: Unique marsupial from Australia, known for its powerful jumps and front pouch.

name: Kingfisher
description: Vibrant bird with a long bill. Kingfishers dive into water to catch fish.

name: Kitten
description: Young, playful cat. Kittens are curious, active, and love to explore.

name: Koala
description: Eucalyptus-loving marsupial with big nose and fluffy ears. Koalas sleep up to 20 hours.

name: Koi
description: Ornamental carp, known for bright colors. Koi are popular in garden ponds.

name: Komodo Dragon
description: Largest living lizard. Komodo dragons are powerful predators from Indonesian islands.

name: Kookaburra
description: Stocky, brown-and-white bird with a loud laugh. Kookaburras eat insects and small prey.

name: Ladybug
description: Small beetle with red wings and black spots. Ladybugs eat aphids and are garden friends.

name: Lamb
description: Young sheep, known for its playful jumps. Lambs are symbols of innocence.

name: Lemur
description: Tree-dwelling primate with big eyes and a long tail. Lemurs are only found in Madagascar.

name: Lion
description: The “king of the jungle.” Lions live in prides and are powerful hunters.

name: Lizard
description: Cold-blooded reptile with scaly skin. Lizards can regrow their tails if lost.

name: Llama
description: Woolly, pack-carrying mammal from South America. Llamas are gentle and social.

name: Lobster
description: Sea creature with a hard shell and large claws. Lobsters live on the ocean floor.

name: Lynx
description: Medium-sized wildcat with tufted ears. Lynx are stealthy and live in forests.

name: Macaw
description: Large, colorful parrot. Macaws have strong beaks and long tails, living in rainforests.

name: Mackerel
description: Fast-swimming, silver fish. Mackerels are important for human consumption.

name: Magpie
description: Intelligent bird with black and white feathers. Magpies are known for collecting objects.

name: Manatee
description: Large, slow-moving sea mammal, also called sea cow. Manatees eat aquatic plants.

name: Mandrill
description: Large monkey with colorful face and rump. Mandrills live in African rainforests.

name: Mare
description: Adult female horse, used for riding and work. Mares are strong and nurturing.

name: Margay
description: Small, agile wild cat from Central/South America. Margays live in trees and hunt at night.

name: Meerkat
description: Small, upright mammal known for sentry duty. Meerkats live in groups in African deserts.

name: Millipede
description: Long-bodied, multi-segmented animal. Millipedes eat decaying plants and live in moist soil.

name: Mole
description: Small, burrowing mammal with velvety fur. Moles are nearly blind and live underground.

name: Mongoose
description: Small, fast mammal famous for snake-fighting skills. Mongooses are clever hunters.

name: Monitor Lizard
description: Large, carnivorous lizard. Monitor lizards are active, strong, and found in Asia/Africa.

name: Monkey
description: Clever, social primate. Monkeys live in troops and swing through trees.

name: Moose
description: The largest species of deer. Moose have broad antlers and live in cold forests.

name: Moray Eel
description: Long, snake-like sea predator. Moray eels hide in reefs and have sharp teeth.

name: Mosquito
description: Small, buzzing insect known for biting and spreading diseases. Mosquitoes love water.

name: Moth
description: Moth with soft, scaly wings. Moths are nocturnal and are attracted to light.

name: Mouse
description: Small, quick rodent with a long tail. Mice are found worldwide and adapt easily.

name: Musk Ox
description: Large, shaggy animal from arctic tundra. Musk oxen have thick fur for extreme cold.

name: Mussel
description: Soft-bodied animal inside a blue-black shell. Mussels cling to rocks in the sea.

name: Narwhal
description: Long-toothed whale with a spiral tusk. Narwhals live in Arctic waters.

name: Newt
description: Small amphibian with a slender body and tail. Newts live both in water and on land.

name: Numbat
description: Small, termite-eating marsupial from Australia. Numbats have striped backs and long tongues.

name: Ocelot
description: Small wildcat with spots and stripes. Ocelots hunt at night in forests of the Americas.

name: Octopus
description: Eight-armed mollusk. Octopuses are clever, flexible, and can camouflage themselves.

name: Okapi
description: Rare, giraffe-like mammal from Africa. Okapis have striped legs and a long tongue.

name: Opposum
description: Small, nocturnal marsupial with a prehensile tail. Opossums are common in the Americas.

name: Orangutan
description: Large, orange ape native to Indonesia. Orangutans are tree-dwellers and use tools.

name: Orca
description: Large, intelligent dolphin, also called killer whale. Orcas live and hunt in groups.

name: Oriole
description: Small, bright yellow or orange songbird. Orioles are known for their hanging nests.

name: Ostrich
description: World’s largest bird, native to Africa. Ostriches run at high speed and lay huge eggs.

name: Otter
description: Playful, fish-eating mammal. Otters have webbed feet and love to swim.

name: Owl
description: Night-hunting bird with large eyes and silent wings. Owls are symbols of wisdom.

name: Oyster
description: Soft-bodied marine animal inside a rough shell. Oysters filter water and can make pearls.

name: Paca
description: Nocturnal, burrowing rodent from South America. Pacas have spotted coats and short tails.

name: Panda
description: Large, black and white bear native to China. Pandas mostly eat bamboo.

name: Pangolin
description: Armored, scale-covered mammal. Pangolins roll into a ball to escape predators.

name: Parakeet
description: Small, colorful parrot with a long tail. Parakeets are playful and often kept as pets.

name: Parrot
description: Intelligent, colorful parrot that can mimic sounds. Parrots are social and long-lived.

name: Peacock
description: Large bird with a vibrant fan tail. Peacocks display to attract mates.

name: Pelican
description: Big water bird with a long bill and throat pouch. Pelicans scoop up fish when feeding.

name: Penguin
description: Flightless, aquatic bird. Penguins “fly” underwater and live in cold southern regions.

name: Pig
description: Domesticated animal with a snout. Pigs are raised for meat and are highly intelligent.

name: Pigeon
description: Small, plump bird common in cities. Pigeons can navigate long distances.

name: Piglet
description: Young pig, small and playful. Piglets grow quickly and love to root in the ground.

name: Pika
description: Small, mountain-dwelling rodent with round ears. Pikas make haypiles for winter.

name: Piranha
description: Small, fierce fish with sharp teeth. Piranhas live in South American rivers.

name: Platypus
description: Egg-laying mammal from Australia. Platypuses have a bill like a duck and webbed feet.

name: Polar Bear
description: White bear native to Arctic. Polar bears are strong swimmers and hunt seals.

name: Porcupine
description: Rodent with a coat of sharp quills for defense. Porcupines are slow-moving but protected.

name: Porpoise
description: Small, toothed whale related to dolphins. Porpoises are shy and swim in coastal waters.

name: Puffin
description: Small, black and white seabird. Puffins have colorful beaks and nest in cliffs.

name: Puppy
description: Young dog, energetic and playful. Puppies are popular pets and learn quickly.

name: Python
description: Large, non-venomous snake. Pythons squeeze prey and can grow to massive sizes.

name: Quail
description: Small, ground-nesting bird. Quails are known for quick dashes and short flights.

name: Quetzal
description: Strikingly colored bird of Central/South America. Quetzals have long tail feathers.

name: Quokka
description: Small, happy-looking marsupial from Australia. Quokkas are famous for their smiles.

name: Rabbit
description: Small, fluffy mammal with long ears. Rabbits dig burrows and eat plants.

name: Raccoon
description: Small, nocturnal mammal with a striped tail. Raccoons are curious and use their hands skillfully.

name: Rat
description: Small, clever rodent with a long tail. Rats thrive in cities and countrysides.

name: Raven
description: Large, intelligent bird. Ravens can mimic sounds and solve puzzles.

name: Red Panda
description: Small, red-furred mammal from Asia. Red pandas are agile and live in bamboo forests.

name: Reindeer
description: Large deer adapted to cold climates. Reindeer are famous for their long migrations.

name: Retriever
description: Friendly, energetic dog breed. Retrievers are great swimmers and love to fetch.

name: Rhea
description: Large, flightless bird from South America. Rheas run fast and live in grasslands.

name: Rhinoceros
description: Large, thick-skinned herbivore with one or two horns. Rhinos are endangered.

name: Rooster
description: Male chicken, famous for its crow. Roosters are colorful and protect their flock.

name: Salamander
description: Moist-skinned amphibian with a long tail. Salamanders are often found near water.

name: Salmon
description: Strong, silvery fish. Salmon migrate from ocean to river to spawn.

name: Samoyed
description: Large, white, fluffy dog. Samoyeds are friendly and great for cold climates.

name: Saola
description: Rare wild bovine from Asia. Saolas have long, straight horns and are very elusive.

name: Sardine
description: Small, oily fish found in large schools. Sardines are vital for the ocean food chain.

name: Scorpion
description: Small, nocturnal predator with pincers and a venomous tail. Scorpions live in deserts.

name: Sea Cucumber
description: Soft, cylindrical animal found on the sea floor. Sea cucumbers clean the ocean bottom.

name: Sea Lion
description: Playful marine mammal with flippers. Sea lions bark loudly and love sunbathing.

name: Seagull
description: Coastal bird with a loud call and white-gray feathers. Seagulls eat almost anything.

name: Seahorse
description: Small fish with a horse-like head. Seahorses swim upright and males carry the young.

name: Seal
description: Marine mammal with flippers and thick blubber. Seals are playful and hunt fish.

name: Serval
description: Medium-sized, spotted wild cat from Africa. Servals have long legs and large ears.

name: Shark
description: Powerful ocean predator with sharp teeth. Sharks have existed for over 400 million years.

name: Sheep
description: Farm animal with thick, curly wool. Sheep are raised for fleece and meat.

name: Shoebill
description: Tall bird with a wide, shoe-shaped bill. Shoebills live in African swamps.

name: Shrimp
description: Small, shrimp-like creature. Shrimps swim backward and are important for ocean food chains.

name: Skunk
description: Small, black and white mammal. Skunks spray a strong odor as defense.

name: Sloth
description: Tree-dwelling mammal famous for slow movement. Sloths eat leaves and sleep a lot.

name: Slug
description: Soft, slimy animal with no shell. Slugs leave a shiny trail as they move.

name: Snail
description: Soft-bodied animal with a spiral shell. Snails are slow movers found in gardens and forests.

name: Snake
description: Long, legless reptile. Snakes swallow prey whole and come in many sizes.

name: Snow Leopard
description: Large wild cat with thick fur and rosettes. Snow leopards live in mountain ranges.

name: Sow
description: Adult female pig, usually the mother of piglets. Sows are kept for breeding.

name: Sparrow
description: Small, cheerful songbird found everywhere. Sparrows chirp and flit in gardens and parks.

name: Spider
description: Eight-legged predator that spins webs to catch insects. Spiders live almost everywhere.

name: Spoonbill
description: Tall wading bird with a wide, spoon-shaped bill. Spoonbills sift mud for food.

name: Squid
description: Marine animal with a soft body and tentacles. Squids can squirt ink to escape predators.

name: Squirrel
description: Small, tree-dwelling rodent with a bushy tail. Squirrels store nuts and leap through trees.

name: Stallion
description: Uncastrated adult male horse. Stallions are strong and often used for breeding.

name: Starfish
description: Star-shaped marine animal. Starfish regenerate lost arms and live on the sea floor.

name: Starling
description: Medium-sized, glossy bird. Starlings mimic sounds and gather in large flocks.

name: Stingray
description: Flat, disc-shaped fish with a venomous tail. Stingrays glide along the ocean bottom.

name: Stork
description: Large, long-legged bird. Storks migrate long distances and build huge nests.

name: Sun Bear
description: Small, tree-climbing bear with a short, sleek coat. Sun bears are found in Southeast Asia.

name: Swordfish
description: Large, powerful fish with a long, sword-like bill. Swordfish are fast swimmers.

name: Swordtail
description: Small, lively fish with a long tail. Swordtails are popular aquarium fish.

name: Tadpole
description: Aquatic larval stage of frogs and toads. Tadpoles have tails and breathe through gills.

name: Tamarin
description: Small monkey from South America with a long tail. Tamarins live in trees and are agile.

name: Tapeworm
description: Parasitic flatworm that lives in intestines. Tapeworms absorb nutrients from their host.

name: Tapir
description: Large, pig-like mammal with a flexible snout. Tapirs live in forests of South America and Asia.

name: Tarsier
description: Tiny nocturnal primate with big eyes. Tarsiers are expert jumpers and insect hunters.

name: Termite
description: Social insect that lives in colonies and eats wood. Termites can damage buildings.

name: Tiger
description: Large, striped big cat native to Asia. Tigers are powerful, solitary hunters.

name: Toad
description: Stocky, warty amphibian. Toads have dry skin and live on land but return to water to breed.

name: Tortoise
description: Land-dwelling reptile with a dome shell. Tortoises are slow and can live over 100 years.

name: Toucan
description: Colorful bird with a giant beak. Toucans live in rainforests and eat fruit.

name: Trout
description: Freshwater fish known for leaping upstream. Trout are prized by anglers.

name: Tuna
description: Fast, large ocean fish. Tuna are important for food and can swim great distances.

name: Turkey
description: Large, ground-dwelling bird. Turkeys have fan-shaped tails and wattled necks.

name: Turtle
description: Reptile with a shell, living mostly in water. Turtles can be found in rivers and seas.

name: Urchin
description: Spiny, round marine animal. Urchins graze on algae and hide in rocky crevices.

name: Urial
description: Wild sheep with curved horns. Urials live in mountains of Central and South Asia.

name: Vulture
description: Large scavenging bird. Vultures feed on carrion and help clean up the environment.

name: Wallaby
description: Small, hopping marsupial from Australia. Wallabies look like kangaroos, but are smaller.

name: Walrus
description: Large marine mammal with long tusks and whiskers. Walruses haul out on ice to rest.

name: Warthog
description: Wild pig with curved tusks and warts on its face. Warthogs run with tails upright.

name: Wasp
description: Aggressive, flying insect with a painful sting. Wasps build papery nests.

name: Weasel
description: Small, fast predator with a long body. Weasels hunt rodents and are very agile.

name: Whale
description: The largest mammal on Earth. Whales breathe air and live in oceans.

name: Wolf
description: Social predator living in packs. Wolves hunt cooperatively in forests and tundra.

name: Wombat
description: Stocky, burrowing marsupial from Australia. Wombats dig tunnels with powerful claws.

name: Woodpecker
description: Bird with a strong beak for drilling into wood. Woodpeckers tap trees for food and nests.

name: Worm
description: Soft-bodied, segmented animal. Worms aerate soil and decompose organic matter.

name: Xerus
description: African ground squirrel with a bushy tail. Xerus live in colonies and dig burrows.

name: Zebra
description: African mammal with black-and-white stripes. Zebras live in herds on open grasslands.

name: Zebu
description: Domesticated cattle with a hump on their shoulders. Zebus are hardy and heat-tolerant.
